timeline.message:
Updated public surface of Connection Policy to use Duration
Updated internal classes to follow the same duration values
Updated Cosmos Client Exception to duration
Updated Throttling Retry Options to Duration
Fixed config and connection policy duration values to seconds

timeline.bodyText:
Duration is not used as a suffix in ConnectionPolicy#setRequestTimeout() and getter.
any reason we are using it here?
what are your thought on the method naming?
timeline.author: moderakh

replies.bodyText: The reason I added Duration here is because getRetryAfter seems very general. It was not clear to me that it returns duration to retry after. So I added that. I can change it to getRetryAfter if you think that is much better.
replies.author: kushagraThapar

replies.bodyText: ok makes sense, getRetryAfterDuration() looks good
replies.author: moderakh

timeline.bodyText:
hmm, do we want "InSeconds()" as suffix in the method name?
the time resolution for this method is seconds. If we are using Duration here we should update the documentation mentioning that the resolution is in seconds.
timeline.author: moderakh

replies.bodyText: We don't want inSeconds() as the suffix in the method name. I will remove it.
replies.author: kushagraThapar

timeline.author: moderakh

timeline.message: Fixed toSeconds() java 11 API to getSeconds() java 8 API
